body_html:
Hi,
I think this belongs in SO. Anyway, "axis 1 is out of bounds for array of dimension 1" means when you are trying to do:

np.argmax(labels,1)

The axis 1 is "out of bounds", meaning it does not exist. Meaning your 'labels' is a 1D array. Try reshaping it or some other stuff by labels.reshape(

Also, you could do:

def accuracy(): np.average(np.argmax(predictions, axis)==np.argmax(labels, axis))

body:
Hi,
I think this belongs in SO. Anyway, "axis 1 is out of bounds for array of dimension 1" means when you are trying to do:
> np.argmax(labels,1)

The axis 1 is "out of bounds", meaning it does not exist. Meaning your 'labels' is a 1D array. Try reshaping it or some other stuff by labels.reshape(

Also, you could do: 

> def accuracy(): np.average(np.argmax(predictions, axis)==np.argmax(labels, axis))
